[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Battleship Simulation System (BSS) defines requirements for an engaging, secure, and user-friendly strategy game.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: BSS supports player management, ship placement, turn-based gameplay, and audio-visual effects.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: BSS integrates with game servers, authentication, and real-time processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: BSS provides an interactive UI with responsive feedback.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: BSS operates on cloud-based and local gaming environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: BSS uses REST APIs for player data and game state management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: BSS ensures encrypted interactions and notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: BSS is optimized for handling multiple concurrent games.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: BSS supports 24/7 gameplay with automated updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: BSS supports multilingual interfaces (English, Spanish, French).
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: BSS links to player management, matchmaking, and analytics.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: BSS facilitates player management, ship placement, turn-based attacks, and battle animations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: BSS is designed for casual players and strategy enthusiasts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: BSS requires internet connectivity for multiplayer mode.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: BSS relies on game servers, external sound effects, and authentication systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Turn-Based Play: Alternating offensive and defensive moves.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with authentication services for player login.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall update game state through REST APIs, ensuring low-latency synchronization.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall maintain a list of available players and allow user identification.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow players to manage game sessions.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage turns by displaying grids, processing shots, updating statuses, and marking ships (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall notify players of hits, misses, and ship conditions (REQ-FUNC-003).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall enforce end-game conditions and allow player status resets (REQ-FUNC-003, REQ-FUNC-004).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a responsive UI with adaptive themes, supporting English, Spanish, and French for accessibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process player actions within 2 seconds for 95% of cases, ensuring real-time responsiveness.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support simultaneous games (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store player states, game progress, shot history, and game statistics for leaderboard rankings.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with W3C web standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to security and privacy best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with failover and load balancing to minimize downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Game mechanics, turn assignments, player actions tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Game rules, UI guides, and localization guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Multiplayer standards, W3C compliance, and UI/UX best practices.
